DataElement.preferredName: Urine M Protein Laboratory Procedure Performed Outcome Integer::0 Decimal Place Milligram per 24 Hours Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 0 decimal place milligram per 24 hour numeric laboratory value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of urinary monoclonal protein in a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Urine M Protein Laboratory Procedure Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The fluid that is excreted by the kidneys.  It is stored in the bladder and discharged through the urethra._A protein complex comprised of two heavy chains and two light chains. Monoclonal immunoglobulin (M protein) is found in abundance in patients who have multiple myeloma. The protein is not produced in response to an antigen, but it is expressed in malignant plasma cells and excreted into the blood and urine._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The fluid that is excreted by the kidneys. Monoclonal immunoglobulin (M protein) is found in abundance in patients who have multiple myeloma. The protein is not produced in response to an antigen, but it is expressed in malignant plasma cells and excreted into the blood and urine.:Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Concepts.definition: The fluid that is excreted by the kidneys.  It is stored in the bladder and discharged through the urethra.

A protein complex comprised of two heavy chains and two light chains. Monoclonal immunoglobulin (M protein) is found in abundance in patients who have multiple myeloma. The protein is not produced in response to an antigen, but it is expressed in malignant plasma cells and excreted into the blood and urine.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome 0 Decimal Place Milligram per 24 Hours Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._The result of an action._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::0_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed._A unit of mass flow rate equivalent to the rate at which one thousandth of a gram of matter crosses a given surface or is delivered to a given object or space over a period of time equal to twenty four hours. Milligram per twenty four hours is also a dose administration rate unit equal to the rate at which one thousandth of a gram of a product is administered per unit of time equal to twenty four hours.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::0 Decimal Place Milligram per 24 Hours Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.:The result of an action.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::0:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A unit of mass flow rate equivalent to the rate at which one thousandth of a gram of matter crosses a given surface or is delivered to a given object or space over a period of time equal to twenty four hours. Milligram per twenty four hours is also a dose administration rate unit equal to the rate at which one thousandth of a gram of a product is administered per unit of time equal to twenty four hours.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.

A unit of mass flow rate equivalent to the rate at which one thousandth of a gram of matter crosses a given surface or is delivered to a given object or space over a period of time equal to twenty four hours. Milligram per twenty four hours is also a dose administration rate unit equal to the rate at which one thousandth of a gram of a product is administered per unit of time equal to twenty four hours.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
